page.title: 12DAVID LIVINGSTONE
page.content: {David Livingstone}(1813-1873), born in Blantyre was a 19th century explorer and missionary. He is famous for his discovery of the{Victoria Falls}and his work against slavery. The David Livingstone Centre, situated on the banks of the Clyde and in the care of a private trust is{Blantyre's greatest tourist attraction with 20,000 visitors a year and is extremely popular with school parties. There is easy access by road or rail. The main part of the centre is the building in which{Livingstone}was born, a room of which has been fashioned to look as it would in Livingstone's day. The Shuttlerow museum comprises displays of local life and industry and the Africa Pavilion furnished by the Commonwealth Institute gives an insight into life in Africa today.
